content.description: bottom appears to be crimpy and steep, with the same kind of slab as the Green Room guarding the chains. Reported in the Edwards guide as un-ascended, anyone got any info on this?
content.location: Just left of the Green room. See photo.

content.description: Bit of a winding route up to the anchors. Good moves in here though.
content.location: The first route you see in the amphitheater as you come down the hill. On your right as you walk down the sloping ramp.

content.description: Low power crux, save gas for high face climbing.
content.protection: 5? bolts to anchor bolts, just hangers. advised to rap off or bring a sacrificial carabiner
content.location: On the only knob with three bolted lines on the west side of the gorge. This one is the furthest uphill of those three. If you're facing the bolt line for green room, turn around and walk up the small slope and turn left, going through a narrow slot. You'll see the arete with Guys and Dolls and Little Shop of horrors. Keep walking past these, and it's on your right on the next block.

content.description: 4 bolts to chains. Delicate slab climbing, really be delicate on those crimps.
content.location: West side of the canyon, on the north side of the first major gully downhill of The Green Room. Start is up a little ramp.

content.description: Starts up some steep crimps into a stopper move into some slab guarding the chains. Area classic.
content.location: East side of the gorge, the line on the right in the photo. just south of the big cave.

content.description:
Recommended to stick clip the first two bolts. Has this seen an ascent? I'm sure it has, I just don't know anything about it other than the name and location.

Equipped by Torrestal 1997
content.location: Left of Green Room and Stage Fright, on the wall forming a right angle to green room. You'd climb this with your back to the ocean.

content.description: Follow the blunt arete to a two bolt anchor. interesting climbing, mediocre rock quality.
content.location: South facing, at the most downhill part of the east side of the canyon.
